TopicTitle: Viewing camera, Cargo bay, EVA reinforce linkages

Articles.Content:
There are some additional parts and functionality that I think would help round out the game's scope

1) Cameras

This would be a 1st person viewing camera part to be put on ships. They could behave similarly to a Kerbal's IVA viewing and require power to operate. Not terribly useful science-wise, but having that viewpoint from the surface of the ship is just cool.

2) Cargo bay

It would be nice to be able to put a satellite into orbit without it precariously balanced on the top of a rocket. The cargo bay would look nice next to the shuttle-based crew module and would function similarly to the real space shuttle. A satellite would be placed inside during assembly, bay doors open in space to launch it. This would be even better with a manipulator arm, which could be its own separate part. The arm would grab and move objects nearby without requiring a docking port. You could add a seat for a Kerbal or an aforesuggested camera on the end.

3) EVA activity: placing reinforcing linkages

This is NOT 'building ships in space'. This involves reinforcing connections between docking ports, particularly useful for space stations that are sent up in parts. A Kerbal on EVA would be able to place struts between two point on the ship, helping to strengthen the connection over the port. A resource functionality similar to fuel and power could be used to limit how many pieces could be added.

agree to all!

The camera would be useful for landing large SSTO or any plane from IVA view. in fact it would make flying from IVA view, much easier.

I want my MK3 CARGO BAY!
